security_audit.summary: This is a documentation template directory containing no executable code. Files are markdown documentation, YAML schemas, and CI/CD configuration templates designed for creating new security skills. All content serves defensive security education purposes.

content.value_statement: Need a standardized way to build security skills? This template provides the structure for creating new skills with documentation, workflows, and configuration templates following SecOpsAgentKit best practices.
actual_capabilities: Provides standardized SKILL.md template with YAML frontmatter
Includes workflow checklist patterns for security operations
Offers reference documentation templates with framework mappings
Delivers CI/CD pipeline templates for security scanning
Contains security rule templates with OWASP/CWE mappings
limitations: This is a template, not an executable skill
Requires customization for specific security tools
No actual security scanning capabilities included
Must be initialized via init_skill.sh script

use_cases.title: Build new security skills
use_cases.description: Create standardized security skills for the SecOpsAgentKit marketplace using proven patterns

use_cases.title: Template CI/CD security
use_cases.description: Use provided CI/CD templates to add security scanning to development workflows

use_cases.title: Document security workflows
use_cases.description: Structure security documentation with workflow checklists and reference materials

prompt_templates.title: Create new skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the skill template to create a new security skill for [specific security tool/capability] in the [appsec|devsecops|secsdlc|threatmodel|compliance|incident-response] category

prompt_templates.title: Add workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a workflow checklist to SKILL.md for [specific security operation] following the patterns in references/WORKFLOW_CHECKLIST.md

prompt_templates.title: Create rule template
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a security rule template in assets/rule-template.yaml for detecting [vulnerability type] with OWASP and CWE mappings

prompt_templates.title: Configure pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Customize the CI/CD pipeline template for [specific security scanning tool] with proper artifact retention and compliance reporting

output_examples.input: Create a new skill template for container security scanning
output: Added workflow checklist for container vulnerability scanning
Configured CI/CD pipeline with container image scanning

best_practices: Keep SKILL.md under 500 lines using progressive disclosure
Move detailed content to references/ directory
Include OWASP, CWE, and MITRE ATT&CK mappings for findings
Validate new skills with ./scripts/validate_skill.py before submission
anti_patterns: Skip placeholder text like TODO or FIXME in final submissions
Avoid deep nesting of reference files beyond one level

faq.question: How do I create a new skill?
faq.answer: Run ./scripts/init_skill.sh <skill-name> <category> to initialize from this template. The script validates name format and creates the directory structure.

faq.question: What categories are supported?
faq.answer: Skills must use one of six categories: appsec, devsecops, secsdlc, threatmodel, compliance, or incident-response.

faq.question: Can I modify the template files?
faq.answer: Never modify skills/_template/ directly. Copy from it to create new skills. The template is the source for all new skills via the init script.

faq.question: How do I validate my skill?
faq.answer: Run ./scripts/validate_skill.py skills/<category>/<skill-name>. This checks YAML frontmatter, versioning, description quality, and script executability.

faq.question: What goes in references vs SKILL.md?
faq.answer: Keep SKILL.md under 500 lines with core workflows. Move detailed framework mappings, extensive rule libraries, and advanced configurations to references/.

faq.question: How do I register a skill in the marketplace?
faq.answer: Update skills/.claude-plugin/marketplace.json to add your skill under the appropriate plugin section after validation passes.
